flawed_nl_solution:
When the price of the book is decreased by 3/20, the total price decrease is 3/20*$400=${<<3/20*400=8000/3>>}8000/3
The new price of the book becomes $400-$8000/3 = ${<<400-8000/3=-6800/3>>}-6800/3
The price of the book is then increased by 2/5*-6800/3 = ${<<2/5*-6800/3=-2720/3>>}-2720/3
The final price of the book is $-6800/3+$-2720/3 = ${<<-6800/3+-2720/3=-9520/3>>}-9520/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 8000/3. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
